stream_context.summary: Kaze finishes the Course 15 rocket interior and shows a tentacled, mutated-Yoshi boss while brainstorming a dramatic “planet-break” arena and a Mario 64 "retro section" made of floating level fragments. He fixes smoke VFX code, monitors ROM/RAM size, and discusses team contributions and personal workload.

development_findings.summary: All main courses are nearly complete; only one sub-area of Course 15 remains before the project enters a polishing phase.
development_findings.quote: After that we have one more sub area to do in course 15 and we're finally done. Oh my God, dude, all the main courses will be finished.

development_findings.summary: Current boss: a mutated Yoshi with tentacles that slam, grow mushrooms (formerly tumors), and spawn baby Yoshis; fight balance and animation still in progress.
development_findings.quote: He slams the tentacles down and you destroy the mushrooms… Right now they look like brain-dead zombies… Zeina's currently animating them.

development_findings.summary: Decision to replace the factory arena with a half-planet that the boss rips apart, providing a cleaner, lower-poly set-piece.
development_findings.quote: Instead of the factory, the Yoshi fight happens on the eighth planet… the planet just breaks apart.

development_findings.summary: Guest authors Hazer and Martiste are contributing side levels; Hazer showed a pastel, wind-slide concept level.
development_findings.quote: It looks very pastel colored. I think it's very pretty.

development_findings.summary: A Mario 64 ‘retro section’ will stitch together small floating snippets of every main course (bridge from BoB, slide from TTM, etc.) to create one star; memory budget checked (~0.5 MB free).
development_findings.quote: We’ll take literally just a piece of the level… floating like this… and RAM looks good, we have just over half a megabyte left.

development_findings.summary: Technical fix: changed Layer 5 to transparent-decal and corrected struct so black smoke VFX now spawns only when in view, saving performance.
development_findings.quote: That was the issue… it needs to only render if it's actually in view.

development_findings.summary: Upgraded rain shader to a full texture for visual improvement.
development_findings.quote: Look at the new rain. It's like a full texture now.

development_findings.summary: BLJ currently crashes the game; root cause unknown and slated for debugging.
development_findings.quote: I still have a rare bug in my game where doing a BLJ crashes.

development_findings.summary: ROM size is 58.8 MB; fits 64 MB target. Memory and performance remain active constraints.
development_findings.quote: It does fit on a 64 megabyte cartridge… 58.8 megabytes, we're still pretty good.

development_findings.summary: Engine/microcode changes broke older levels; large round of bug-fixing planned after Course 15.
development_findings.quote: This is what happens when you keep changing the engine, all the levels just break.

context_findings.summary: Kaze refuses option-bloat; prioritises clear design over endless settings.
context_findings.quote: People always ask for more and more… I would have an option menu with 260 items and it would be shit.

context_findings.summary: He is extremely busy and struggles to fit community requests or extra tasks.
context_findings.quote: Dude, I'm just so fucking busy. I generally just do not have time to do anything.

context_findings.summary: Monetisation: pays $5 per short to an external creator; dislikes YouTube’s large donation cut and prefers PayPal.
context_findings.quote: YouTube does take a large cut of it… I told him, alright, I'll give you $5 per short.

context_findings.summary: Personal life: parents visiting to see the baby tomorrow; feeling unprepared.
context_findings.quote: My parents are coming tomorrow to look at the baby. I'm not prepared to have so many people here.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s open-source philosophy: anyone may use his assets if they can do so without his support; he avoids maintenance burden.
context_findings.quote: If you are able to use my stuff without my help, then you're free to use it.

biobak.summary: Provides ongoing graphic feedback (UV mapping issues, hologram praise) and created a banner for a house interior.
Engaged in arena concept discussion, suggesting debris and visual ideas.

badub.summary: Will compose the music for the Mario 64 retro section; Kaze plans to brief him on style.
badub.quote: I can suggest it to Badub, but maybe he has a good idea with it.

zeina.summary: Animating the baby Yoshis for the boss fight; their current static model looks "like brain-dead zombies."
zeina.quote: Zeina's currently animating them, so hopefully they will be better once they are animated.

key_stories.title: From Tumors to Mushrooms
key_stories.summary: Early versions of the boss had grotesque tumors that testers found too disturbing. Kaze swapped them for cartoony mushrooms that still serve the same gameplay purpose.
key_stories.challenge: Player feedback deemed the tumor visuals "way too disgusting."
key_stories.process: Re-skinned the growths as mushrooms and ensured the boss logic remembers which ones are popped.
key_stories.outcome: Visual tone now fits Yoshi aesthetic without causing revulsion.
key_stories.key_quote: I had him grow tumors… someone said this is way too disgusting, so I changed the tumors into mushrooms.

key_stories.title: Pivot to Planet Arena
key_stories.summary: Kaze and chat concluded the factory arena felt uninspired. They brainstormed a dramatic half-planet that the boss destroys as the fight begins.
key_stories.challenge: Existing factory set-piece felt cluttered and polygon-heavy.
key_stories.process: Live modelling of an icosphere, discussion of cutscene triggers, debris, and lower‐poly benefits.
key_stories.outcome: Decision logged to scrap factory and build the planet arena instead.
key_stories.key_quote: We don't need the factory. Planet is cooler.

key_stories.title: Smoke VFX Debug
key_stories.summary: Hot engine pipes in the spaceship needed cooling smoke, but the particle failed to render.
key_stories.challenge: Smoke spawned invisibly after engine code refactor.
key_stories.process: Traced to struct change and Layer 5 switch; added on-screen spawning check for performance.
key_stories.outcome: Smoke now appears only when camera can see it, allowing heavier effects without slowdown.
key_stories.key_quote: That was the issue… now we can add so much fucking smoke.

open_questions.context: Concept approved to replace factory with a planet the Yoshi destroys, but specifics (cutscene timing, debris physics, safe zones) remain undecided.
questions: How will the planet break animation be achieved technically on N64?
What triggers the cutscene and how is player control handled?
Will debris affect gameplay or be purely visual?

open_questions.context: Kaze floated ideas (Bowser mech, Bowser with Yoshi abilities) but said nothing is set.
questions: What narrative and mechanical role will the final boss play?
How will the Yoshi labour plotline pay off?
Which team members will handle model, music, and code?

open_questions.context: Zeina is working on animations; current placeholders hinder fight balance testing.
questions: What animation sets are planned (idle, swim, attack)?
Will behaviors change alongside new animations?

open_questions.context: Floating snippets idea approved, but selection and performance impact unclear.
questions: Exact list of course fragments to include?
How will transitions be handled (warps, bridges, braids)?
Is 0.5 MB RAM really sufficient once models and enemies load?

open_questions.context: Backward long jump occasionally crashes; no known cause.
questions: What conditions reproduce the crash reliably?
Is it linked to action-state switching as Kaze suspects?
Could the fix impact other movement mechanics?

open_questions.context: Hazer and Martiste are building levels externally.
questions: What is the pipeline for importing their geometry/assets?
How are style and difficulty being coordinated?
What deadlines exist for their submissions?
